This was the first ever competitive match between Croatia and Albania.
Thomas Strakosha made eight saves overall and was a key part in Albania deservedly getting something out of a rollercoaster game.
Mario Mandzukic, now an assistant coach with Croatia, could be seen leaping from the dugout to demand his players match Albania’s intensity in the first half.
The noise in the Volksparkstadion was deafening after Albania's equaliser.
Albania's gritty determination and effective counterattacking were notable despite their lower ranking compared to Croatia.
Croatia struggled to create chances in the first half but goalkeeper Dominik Livakovic made crucial saves to keep the score 1-0 at halftime.
The Volksparkstadion in Hamburg was split evenly between Albania and Croatia fans, creating a loud and energetic atmosphere.
Fans in Croatia’s section set off flares repeatedly despite warnings over the loudspeakers.
Croatia had 22 shot attempts compared to Albania's 15.
Croatia had 67% possession while Albania had 33%.
Croatia had 10 shots on goal compared to Albania's 7.
Croatia made 5 saves while Albania made 8.
Croatia had 3 corner kicks while Albania had 1.
The match was held at Volksparkstadion in Hamburg, Germany.
